VOLUMES.VOLUM_DESC: Managed by Docker, persists even after the container is removed. Recommended for production.
VOLUMES.BIND_MOUNT_DESC: Directly links a host folder to the container. Useful for development and file sharing.
VOLUMES.TMPFS_DESC: Temporary in-memory storage. Fast but not persistent. Ideal for caches.

USER.ALERT_MSG: Never run as root in production! Always use a non-privileged user to minimize security risks.
USER.EXEC_DESC: Choose the user that will run the application inside the container
USER.TIP_UID_DESC: Use UID/GID > 1000 to avoid conflicts with system users.
USER.TIP_SHELL_DESC: Use /usr/sbin/nologin if the user does not require interactive shell access.
USER.TIP_PERM_DESC: The user should only have the permissions strictly necessary for the application.

SECURITY.NOTE_MSG: The security options below are applied with docker run, not in the Dockerfile. They will be documented in the preview.
SECURITY.RECO_PRIV_DESC: Remove all unnecessary capabilities and use a non-root user.
SECURITY.RECO_FS_DESC: Enable --read-only and use temporary volumes for writable directories.
SECURITY.RECO_AUDIT_DESC: Use tools like Falco to monitor suspicious activity in real time.
